intro: Scrophularia methanaea, commonly known as the lesser scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, bright yellow flowers with red markings. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Scrophularia methanaea is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
